document.p: The Access Control List section on the Wi-Fi page allows you to grant or deny devices access to your Wi-Fi access.
document.li1:
ACL mode
Allows you to select the default behavior of the access control list.
document.li2:
Blacklist
By default, all devices with correct Wi-Fi settings (SSID, Wi-Fi key, etc.) are able to connect except those listed in the MAC Address table. The MAC address table works as blacklist.

Whitelist
By default, Wi-Fi access is blocked for all except for those listed in the MAC Address table. The MAC address table works as whitelist.
document.li1:
If the ACL is enabled, the MAC address table is displayed.
Click Add new MAC addresses to add exceptions on the default behavior.
